result.execSummary:
The defendant Robin A Yurkonis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 10:50am [mo]
Defendant Robin A Yurkonis in court with attorney Thomas J Laitsch.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--continue with all treatment recommendations of Dr. Froelich or other treating psychiatrist or phychologist
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--letter of apology to D.Y., Christopher Duha and David Yurkonis as approved by Agent and treating psychiatrist
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  1  days

Case called at 1:26pm [mo]
Defendant Robin A Yurkonis appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (For bond purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Hagemann indicates that the PD represents Ms. Yurkonis for Bond Purposes only at this time 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to Counsel given
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires a $1,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--No Contact with David Yurkonis or the juvenile with the initials D.Y.
--take all medications as prescribed
recess 1:29 pm.
